message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NA, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with classification on symmetric positive definite matrices, which is a common problem in computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method is based on sparse representation (cs.LG) and involves embedding the matrices into a Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Space (RKHS), which is a common technique in machine learning (cs.AI). The method also exploits the geodesic distance between SPD matrices, which is a concept from differential geometry (cs.NA). Finally, the paper involves some mathematical analysis of the proposed method, which could fall under information theory (cs.IT).
